item.description:
This first meeting is just to set the group up and to allow the people to meet each other. Snacks will be provided.

I would recommend that all participants start by consulting the website of the Asperger's Association of New England (www.aane.org), based in Watertown, for suggestions and advice.

Snacks will be provided.

Note that I myself (the organizer) may be able to provide an unusual perspective. I am a self-diagnosed Aspie who has managed to overcome the disability enough to hold a full-time software engineering job, live alone, and find a girlfriend. One thing I suggest is use special interests in a way which will benefit you and society as a whole. Furthermore, never stop learning.

As a wise old Aspie math geek once wrote in high school, "all these mathematical theories are useless when I try to figure out why I am in love."
item.how_to_find_us: This preliminary meeting will be at my apartment. We'll figure out what to do from there.
item.why: You will be able to hear about other people's strategies for coping with Asperger's adults and children.
item.name: The Boston Asperger's Syndrome March Meeting
